nodes.label: Introduction to Linear Algebra
nodes.description: Understand the fundamental concepts and the scope of linear algebra.

nodes.label: Vectors and Vector Operations
nodes.description: Learn about vectors, their representation, and basic arithmetic operations.

nodes.label: Linear Combinations & Span
nodes.description: Explore how vectors can be combined and the space they can generate.

nodes.label: Linear Independence
nodes.description: Determine if a set of vectors is linearly independent or dependent.

nodes.label: Matrices & Matrix Operations
nodes.description: Study matrices, their types, and operations like addition and multiplication.

nodes.label: Solving Linear Systems
nodes.description: Master techniques like Gaussian elimination to find solutions for systems of equations.

nodes.label: Inverse Matrices & Determinants
nodes.description: Understand how to find matrix inverses and calculate determinants.

nodes.label: Vector Subspaces
nodes.description: Investigate vector subspaces, including column, row, and null spaces.

nodes.label: Linear Transformations
nodes.description: Grasp how matrices can represent geometric transformations of vectors.

nodes.label: Basis & Dimension
nodes.description: Define a basis for a vector space and determine its dimension.

nodes.label: Eigenvalues & Eigenvectors
nodes.description: Discover special vectors that are only scaled by linear transformations.

nodes.label: Diagonalization
nodes.description: Learn to simplify matrix operations by transforming them into diagonal forms.

nodes.label: Orthogonality
nodes.description: Explore orthogonal vectors, orthogonal bases, and projections.

nodes.label: Inner Product Spaces
nodes.description: Generalize dot products to abstract vector spaces and define norms.

nodes.label: Gram-Schmidt Process
nodes.description: Construct an orthonormal basis from any given basis in an inner product space.

nodes.label: Counting Objects
nodes.description: Count a given set of objects up to 10.

nodes.label: Concept of 'More'
nodes.description: Understand what it means to have a greater quantity.

nodes.label: Combining Sets
nodes.description: Physically group two sets of objects and count the total.

nodes.label: Adding with Pictures
nodes.description: Count and combine pictures to find the total sum.

nodes.label: Addition on Number Line
nodes.description: Use a number line to visualize and perform simple addition.

nodes.label: Basic Addition Facts (0-5)
nodes.description: Memorize and quickly recall addition facts where sums are up to 5.

nodes.label: Commutative Property
nodes.description: Understand that changing the order of addends does not change the sum.

nodes.label: Addition Facts (6-10)
nodes.description: Memorize and quickly recall addition facts where sums are up to 10.

nodes.label: Adding Three Numbers
nodes.description: Add three single-digit numbers together to find the sum.

nodes.label: Place Value Review
nodes.description: Understand tens and ones place values in two-digit numbers.

nodes.label: Double-Digit Addition (No Regrouping)
nodes.description: Add two-digit numbers without needing to carry over to the next place value.

nodes.label: Double-Digit Addition (With Regrouping)
nodes.description: Add two-digit numbers, carrying tens over to the next place value.

nodes.label: Triple-Digit Addition
nodes.description: Add three-digit numbers, including regrouping across place values.

nodes.label: Addition Word Problems
nodes.description: Solve real-world problems that involve addition.

nodes.label: Introduction to OOP
nodes.description: Understand the basic principles and benefits of Object-Oriented Programming.

nodes.label: Classes and Objects
nodes.description: Learn how to define classes as blueprints and create objects as instances.

nodes.label: Fields and Methods
nodes.description: Explore how to define attributes (fields) and behaviors (methods) for objects.

nodes.label: Constructors
nodes.description: Discover special methods used for initializing objects upon creation.

nodes.label: Encapsulation
nodes.description: Understand how to bundle data and methods, and control access using modifiers.

nodes.label: Inheritance Basics
nodes.description: Learn the concept of one class inheriting properties and behaviors from another.

nodes.label: Method Overriding
nodes.description: Understand how a subclass can provide its own implementation for an inherited method.

nodes.label: `super` Keyword
nodes.description: Learn to use the `super` keyword to refer to parent class members.

nodes.label: Method Overloading
nodes.description: Discover how to define multiple methods with the same name but different parameters.

nodes.label: Polymorphism Basics
nodes.description: Grasp the concept of objects taking on many forms, enabling flexible code.

nodes.label: Abstract Classes
nodes.description: Understand how to create partial blueprints that cannot be instantiated directly.

nodes.label: Interfaces
nodes.description: Learn to define contracts for classes to implement, achieving multiple inheritance of type.

nodes.label: Composition
nodes.description: Explore the 'has-a' relationship where one object is made up of other objects.

nodes.label: `final` Keyword
nodes.description: Understand how to use `final` for immutability and preventing inheritance/overriding.

nodes.label: `static` Keyword
nodes.description: Learn about members that belong to the class itself rather than any specific object.

nodes.label: Introduction to Archery
nodes.description: Understand the basics, history, and different disciplines of archery.

nodes.label: Range Safety Rules
nodes.description: Learn the essential safety protocols and etiquette for an archery range.

nodes.label: Basic Equipment Overview
nodes.description: Identify and understand the fundamental components of a bow and arrow.

nodes.label: Proper Stance and Body Form
nodes.description: Develop a stable and balanced shooting stance for consistency.

nodes.label: Holding the Bow Correctly
nodes.description: Master the correct grip and hand placement on the bow.

nodes.label: Nocking the Arrow and Grip
nodes.description: Learn how to properly place an arrow on the string and establish a finger tab or release aid grip.

nodes.label: Drawing and Releasing the String
nodes.description: Execute a smooth draw to anchor point and a clean, consistent release.

nodes.label: Basic Aiming Techniques
nodes.description: Understand fundamental aiming principles using sights or barebow methods.

nodes.label: The Importance of Follow Through
nodes.description: Maintain your shot form after the arrow leaves the bow for improved accuracy.

nodes.label: Sight Adjustment and Tuning
nodes.description: Learn to adjust your bow sight for different distances and conditions.

nodes.label: Grouping Drills and Practice
nodes.description: Engage in targeted practice routines to tighten arrow groups on the target.

nodes.label: Wind Compensation and External Factors
nodes.description: Understand how to adjust your aim and technique for varying wind conditions and other environmental challenges.

nodes.label: Mental Game and Focus
nodes.description: Develop strategies for concentration, managing pressure, and maintaining a positive mindset during shooting.

nodes.label: Advanced Equipment Maintenance
nodes.description: Learn to perform routine and advanced care for your bow, arrows, and accessories.

nodes.label: Exploring Different Bow Types
nodes.description: Gain knowledge about recurve, compound, and traditional bows, including their mechanics and shooting styles.

nodes.label: Competition Preparation and Rules
nodes.description: Understand competition formats, scoring, and mental readiness for competitive archery events.

nodes.label: Advanced Bow Tuning and Customization
nodes.description: Master advanced tuning techniques to optimize bow performance and personalize equipment for peak accuracy.

nodes.label: Introduction to Vectors
nodes.description: Understand what vectors are, their geometric interpretation, and basic notation.

nodes.label: Vector Operations
nodes.description: Learn how to add vectors, multiply by scalars, and compute dot products.

nodes.label: Linear Combinations and Span
nodes.description: Explore how vectors can be combined to form new vectors and define a space.

nodes.label: Linear Independence
nodes.description: Determine if a set of vectors is linearly independent or dependent.

nodes.label: Systems of Linear Equations
nodes.description: Solve systems of linear equations using techniques like Gaussian elimination.

nodes.label: Matrices and Matrix Operations
nodes.description: Grasp matrix definitions, addition, scalar multiplication, and matrix multiplication.

nodes.label: Matrix Inverses and Determinants
nodes.description: Discover how to find inverse matrices and compute determinants for square matrices.

nodes.label: Vector Spaces and Subspaces
nodes.description: Understand the abstract definition of vector spaces and their fundamental properties.

nodes.label: Basis and Dimension
nodes.description: Define a basis for a vector space and determine its dimension.

nodes.label: Linear Transformations
nodes.description: Explore functions that preserve vector addition and scalar multiplication between vector spaces.

nodes.label: Change of Basis
nodes.description: Learn how to convert vector coordinates and matrix representations between different bases.

nodes.label: Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors
nodes.description: Understand special vectors that are only scaled by a linear transformation.

nodes.label: Orthogonality and Projections
nodes.description: Study perpendicular vectors, orthogonal complements, and how to project one vector onto another.

nodes.label: Singular Value Decomposition (SVD)
nodes.description: Decompose a matrix into three simpler matrices for powerful analysis and applications.

nodes.label: Obtaining a Learners Permit
nodes.description: Understand the requirements and process for acquiring a learner's permit.

nodes.label: Vehicle Familiarization
nodes.description: Learn to identify and understand the function of essential vehicle components.

nodes.label: Starting Stopping and Steering
nodes.description: Master the basic actions of starting the engine, stopping the vehicle, and steering.

nodes.label: Basic Road Rules and Signs
nodes.description: Familiarize yourself with fundamental traffic laws, road signs, and pavement markings.

nodes.label: Lane Changes and Turns
nodes.description: Practice safe and effective techniques for changing lanes and executing turns.

nodes.label: Parking Fundamentals
nodes.description: Learn the basics of parallel parking, perpendicular parking, and angle parking.

nodes.label: Traffic Lights and Intersections
nodes.description: Understand how to navigate various types of intersections and obey traffic signals.

nodes.label: Backing and Reversing
nodes.description: Develop control and awareness when driving in reverse, including using mirrors effectively.

nodes.label: Freeway Driving
nodes.description: Learn to safely enter, navigate, and exit highways and freeways at higher speeds.

nodes.label: Driving in Adverse Weather
nodes.description: Understand techniques for driving safely in rain, snow, fog, and other challenging conditions.

nodes.label: Defensive Driving Techniques
nodes.description: Adopt strategies to anticipate hazards, react safely, and avoid collisions.

nodes.label: Managing Distractions and Fatigue
nodes.description: Learn to identify and mitigate the risks associated with distracted or fatigued driving.

nodes.label: Emergency Procedures
nodes.description: Know how to react effectively to tire blowouts, brake failure, and other vehicle emergencies.

nodes.label: Preparing for the Driving Test
nodes.description: Review all skills and regulations necessary to pass the practical driving examination.

nodes.label: Vehicle Maintenance Basics
nodes.description: Understand fundamental vehicle maintenance tasks to ensure safety and longevity.
